Package sorters

Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorters.QuickSort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sorter
    public class QuickSort
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sorter
    This class implements the quick sort algorithm. See https://www.toptal.com/developers/sorting-algorithms/quick-sort for an explanation of the quick sort algorithm.

      • quickSort

        public static int[] quickSort​(int startLeftPoint,
                              int startRightPoint,
                              int[] arrayToSort)
        A 'pivot' point is set as the midpoint in the array between the two starting points, which by default are the first and last indexes of the argument array. The left starting point increments up until the value at that index is greater than the value at the pivot. The right starting point decrements until it has a value less than the value at the pivot. Swap these two values then recur the method using the new starting points until the points 'meet in the middle'
        Parameters:
        startLeftPoint - 0 by default
        startRightPoint - array.length -1 by default
        arrayToSort - unsorted array
        Returns:
        sorted array

      • findAndSwapValues

        private static void findAndSwapValues​(int leftPoint,
                                      int rightPoint,
                                      int pivot,
                                      int[] arrayToSort)
        Find the next two values to be swapped and swap them using Swap.swapCharacters.
        Parameters:
        leftPoint - current index left of the pivot
        rightPoint - current index right of the pivot
        pivot - current pivot
        arrayToSort - unsorted array

      • checkIfRecurrenceNeeded

        private static void checkIfRecurrenceNeeded​(int startLeftPoint,
                                            int startRightPoint,
                                            int leftPoint,
                                            int rightPoint,
                                            int[] arrayToSort)
        If the points either side of the pivot have not 'met' then the quickSort method must be recurred.
        Parameters:
        startLeftPoint - starting left index (0)
        startRightPoint - starting right index (length - 1)
        leftPoint - current left index
        rightPoint - current right index
        arrayToSort - unsorted array
